metadata.title: CVE-2019-10747 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
set-value is vulnerable to Prototype Pollution in versions lower than 3.0.1. The function mixin-deep could be tricked into adding or modifying properties of Object.prototype using any of the constructor, prototype and _proto_ payloads.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10747` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

node-set-value - 0.4.0-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: node-set-value package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.4.0-2').
